input_text: ‘No guardrails’: How India-Pakistan combat obliterated old red lines

reformatting.result: Reformatted query: India-Pakistan conflict impact on geopolitical boundaries

news_query_extraction.result: India-Pakistan combat, old red lines, geopolitical tensions, military escalation

summarization.result:
Here are what other news sources are saying:

1. Business Insider reported on China's J-10C fighter jet being deployed by Pakistan against India and highlighted its potential as a competitor to western rivals. The article discussed the key features and strategic significance of the Chengdu J-10C jet in China's air power strategy.
Source: [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-j10-fighter-jet-f-16-pakistan-air-force-2025-5)

2. NPR covered the India-Pakistan ceasefire, noting that it has held for a second day, marking a significant pause in hostilities between the two countries. The report also mentioned India's suspension of a key water-sharing treaty amidst the ongoing developments.
Source: [NPR](https://www.npr.org/2025/05/12/g-s1-65967/india-pakistan-kashmir-ceasefire)

3. BBC News provided updates on the top military officials from India and Pakistan scheduled to speak about the ceasefire agreement. Both nations have maintained vigilance despite the ceasefire announcement, signaling ongoing tensions in the region.
Source: [BBC News](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cm26760pj13o)

4. Al Jazeera English analyzed the military and nuclear capabilities of India and Pakistan, emphasizing their defense spending and strengths in conventional and nuclear arsenals. The article delved into recent missile attacks between the two countries, highlighting the implications of their arms race.
Source: [Al Jazeera English](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/5/8/what-are-india-and-pakistans-military-and-nuclear-capabilities)

Here is some relevant discourse on this and related issues on Reddit:

A Reddit post discussed Trump's offer to help relieve conflict between India and Pakistan, drawing parallels to his handling of other international conflicts. Users expressed skepticism and caution regarding Trump's involvement, with some highlighting the complexities of the situation and the historical tensions between the two nations.
Source: [Reddit - Politics](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/07/trump-india-pakistan-kashmir.html)
